function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Potential spread of covid-19 through person-to-person contact","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of control over the environment and workplace conditions","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited awareness and compliance with safety guidelines","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Varying success rates of policies based on location, density, and cultural practices.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of research on pandemic governance.","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limitation of the study to only architectural, urban, and public realm scales.","category":"Structures","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"People not following covid-19 protocols such as maintaining six feet distance and other health protocols","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Psychological difficulty in making people follow the protocols","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Congestion and lack of social distancing in urban spaces and social gathering areas","category":"Structures","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of adoption of pandemic-resistant urban design recommendations","category":"Structures","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Evolution of crisis leading to uncertain conclusions","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Congregations in public spaces increase the risk of virus transmission due to close contact and crowded environments.","category":"Structures","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Dependence on physical presence for the functioning of public spaces creates a challenge in controlling virus transmission.","category":"Structures","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Economic impact of a complete lockdown creates pressure to design and build resilient public spaces to withstand future pandemics.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Promoting development horizontally and maintaining lower density","category":"Structures","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inclusive urban planning and management of multi-functional public spaces over preventive design strategies","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Intermixing of public realms, social spaces, and green infrastructure","category":"Structures","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Reduction in public transportation usage leading to increased use of private vehicles","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increase in online shopping leading to reduced physical footfall in retail spaces","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of physical distancing in public spaces","category":"Structures","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inadequate monitoring of public spaces","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inadequate adaptation of urban design to promote physical distancing","category":"Structures","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Increased reliance on online shopping as a result of in-person shopping limitations","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Link between average income, age group, and virus transmission","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Challenges of stay-at-home orders in neighborhoods without public or private open spaces","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Zone-based lockdown for covid-19 suppression","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of consideration for pandemic consequences in architectural and urban design education","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Shift in social behavior and neighborhood dynamics due to covid-19","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Horizontal expansion and decentralization can lead to increased transmission of contagious diseases due to greater connectivity between different areas.","category":"Structures","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Differences in income and class can lead to unequal access to safe public spaces and increased vulnerability to contagious diseases.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"High-density districts and crowded urban areas can lead to higher morbidity rates of covid-19 and increased areas","category":"Structures","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Impact on socio-economic composition of cities","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High density urban areas facilitating easier transmission of communicable diseases due to increased social contact","category":"Structures","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inadequate management of multi-functional public spaces leading to increased risk of virus transmission","category":"Structures","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Overcrowding due to concentration of amenities leading to increased risk of virus pandemic of covid-19 causing daily loss of lives and economic downturn","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased transmissibility of sars-cov-2
